alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 30 at 6:23AM MST until December 02 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible in the mountains and Yellowstone NP; 8 to 12 inches in the Jackson and Star Valleys. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph in the higher elevations Thursday. * WHERE...Portions of western Wyoming. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially over Teton and Togwotee Passes. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park
